Test data documentation

Carmen Navarro

2024-09-25

Source: vignettes/test-data.Rmd
test-data.Rmd

Summary

This is a small document describing the data used to test wigglescout functionality. Since most of the functions look at genomic intervals, the files provided are BED files and are included in the package.

Files content

The provided files are two differently scored BED files and corresponding mock background files (i.e. input files) to test calculations. These contain two chromosomes chr1 and chr2 of length 200bp each, where signal goes from 1 to 20 and from 20 to 1 on each.

Background files have flat signals of 1 and 2 for the same intervals.

Additionally, there is an annotation file for two types of regions, to validate summarizing and aggregation across different length intervals.

This dataset will be extended if functionality grows.

library(wigglescout)
library(rtracklayer)

ranges <- import(system.file("testdata", "bed1.bed", package="wigglescout"))
ranges
#> GRanges object with 20 ranges and 2 metadata columns:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |        name     score
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> <numeric>
#>    [1]     chr1      1-20      * |        <NA>         1
#>    [2]     chr1     21-40      * |        <NA>         2
#>    [3]     chr1     41-60      * |        <NA>         3
#>    [4]     chr1     61-80      * |        <NA>         4
#>    [5]     chr1    81-100      * |        <NA>         5
